title: Paix Sur Terre 2015 Glenrose Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Crisp green pear and a razor-thin sharpness cut into more lush kiwi and honeysuckle notes on the nose of this bottling. A steely line of Key lime slices through the white peach flavors once sipped, and the palate cleans up with a tense, chalky grip.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2014 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A greeting of caramel and honey reveals a touch of barrel reduction in this medium-bodied, generously layered wine. It imparts a ripeness of melon and apple, finishing in a sprinkling of nutmeg.

title: Stonestreet 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Dusty cedar and a faintness of rose open this wine, like walking into a lovely forest at the edge of a garden. Along with a delicate supporting role of oak and tannin, it offers black cherry, graphite and dried herb to enjoy, as well as a powerful hit of concentration on the finish.

title: Hersly 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This medium-bodied, small-production red was given a light touch of oak, only 25% of it new and French, allowing the other characteristics to speak louder than the wood. Compact tannins support a juicy, youthfully grippy frame of pomegranate and orange that opens further in the glass.

title: Tenor 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas bring notes of herbs, green olive, flowers and blue and black fruit. The blue fruit flavors are ripe and full bodied, with spice flavors lingering on the finish.

title: Domaine Landrat-Guyollot 2012 Des Cuvées Exquises Gemme Océane  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Full of black currant and perfumed apple fruits, this is a wine that has filled out as it has matured while not losing its tight mineral character. It is a complex wine, tasting of the terroir, structured and fruity at the same time. Drink this impressive wine now.

title: Höpler 2015 Guttenberg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: Made from very ripe grapes harvested as late as November, this Grüner shows us depth despite its light, fresh palate. Creamy notes of yellow plum have the softest touch of vanilla. This has a pliable, sinuous body and is a more thoughtful, rounded but still very fresh rendition of this enduring Austrian favorite.

title: McCall 2009 Reserve Corhaug Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Wisps of cocoa powder and cinnamon lend a warm, spicy tone to this rich, berry-toned wine. Ripe black plum and blackberry flavors are lipsmackingly fruity but calibrated neatly by crisp acidity and fine, chalky tannins. The finish is long and lingering.

title: Lieubeau 2012 Château de l'Aulnaye Cru Château-Thébaud  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: From a parcel of vines at Château de l'Aulnaye in the Château-Thébaud area, this is now a mature, ripe and smooth wine, It has a flinty edge along with richer yellow fruits and mint. This concentrated wine is ready to drink.

title: Llopart 2011 Panoramic Reserva Imperial Sparkling (Cava)
description: This long-aged (42 months) vintage Cava opens with a whiff of exotic bath soap along with more familiar apple and pear scents. There's yeasty, creamy weight to the palate and flavors of fresh-baked bread, spent yeast and papaya. Mild lees and cream notes grace the finish.

title: Mullan Road 2013 Red Wine Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is principally Cabernet Sauvignon (57%) and Merlot (34%) along with dashes of Cabernet Franc and Malbec. A blend of Royal Slope and Seven Hills Vineyard fruit, it opens with aromas of black cherry, cigar box, green herbs, dried mint and potpourri. The herb and dark-fruit flavors are ripe and expressive, with the tannins combed to a fine sheen.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A rich nose of vanilla-bean ice cream, Marcona almond, buttered cornbread and pan-seared pear makes for a very inviting entry to this bottling. The vanilla and caramel flavors extend to the palate, but in a judiciously light way, with candied pecans, baked fruit and honeysuckle flavors, altogether quite delicious.

title: The Drift 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild Kindred Shiraz-Malbec-Barbera Red (Overberg)
description: Winemaker: Bruce Jack. A blend of equal parts Shiraz, Malbec and Barbera, this leads with jammy yet fresh aromas of lush raspberry, cherry and plum, all hit with dustings of black pepper and chocolate. Rich berry flavors carry through to the medium-weight palate, framed by fine yet supportive tannins and ample acidity. The crushed velvet texture is complemented by final notes of licorice and toasted peppercorn. Drink now–2022.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2012 Las Flores Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Winemaker Molly Lyman takes a delicate approach to this 100% varietal estate wine, from a longstanding vineyard in the Chiles Valley. From a block named for a farming family linked to the site, Las Flores is sanguine in cranberry and graphite, food-friendly, with a lightness despite its pronounced plum, cassis and oak.

title: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of spice, red fruit and milk chocolate are followed by an opulent palate of fruit and barrel flavors. It appeals on every level.

title: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a rare, 100% varietal, single-vineyard Malbec. It downright dazzles with notes of dark plum and spice that are followed by seamless, pure, elegant fruit flavors.

title: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Sagemoor Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Hailing from some of the oldest blocks at this esteemed vineyard, this standout wine opens with aromas of toasty spices, herbs, coffee, dark cherry and earth. The palate is reserved with tightly wound fruit flavors and tannins that need some time to unfurl.

title: Waterford 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild 1988 Kept Aside Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Kevin Arnold. There's a lovely oaky lushness throughout this wine, though it's not overdone and it's appropriately balanced by notes of yellow apple, pear, pressed flower and a touch of baking spice, as well as a vibrant seam of citrusy acidity. The palate offers more ripe fruit flavors, with a mineral edge and a lingering, soft spice accent on the finish. It's certainly delicious now, though this will age gracefully through 2021.

title: Kale 2013 Kick Ranch Vineyard Home Run Cuvée Syrah-Grenache (Sonoma County)
description: Made from 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache, both grown at the terrific Kick Ranch hillside site, this wine has a robustness of dark cherry and a red-brick color, soft, smooth and youthful in its seamless tannin and oak. Juicy dark blueberry and a touch of meaty spice form an enviable combination just ready for meaty dishes.
designation: Kick Ranch Vineyard Home Run Cuvée

title: Keating 2013 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)
description: This is a lovely, while bombastically full-bodied, 100% varietal wine, brooding in blackberry jam, peppery cinnamon and an inviting floral nose of cherry blossom. The body drinks lean despite its power and underlying ripeness, remaining lengthy and complex through the finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Kokomo 2014 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Juicy like a cherry cordial, this medium-bodied vineyard-designate drinks lean and gracefully, showing a spunky side seasoned in cinnamon and clove.

title: Dusted Valley 2013 BFM Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: At 81%, this could be a varietally labeled Merlot, with the rest Cabernet Franc (15%) and Petit Verdot. It appeals with pretty aromas of cocoa, wood spice and jammy red fruit that are followed by full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors that pack a wallop while staying in balance.

title: Enzo Boglietti 2012 Brunate  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of toast, roasted herb, dark-skinned berry, mint and a balsamic note lead the way. The young, firm palate offers dark cherry, black raspberry and white pepper framed in austere tannins and bright acidity. It's still young and needs to unwind. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Etienne le Riche 2007 Cape Winemakers Guild Special Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Etienne le Riche. Pleasantly herbal tones of fynbos, mint, licorice root and violet grace the black cherry and boysenberry fruit core of this wine. The medium-weight mouthfeel offers gripping but not overbearing tannins, with ripe black-fruit tones that flesh out the palate. Final notes of bittersweet cocoa, wood spice and a touch of tobacco linger long on the close. It's mature enough to enjoy now, though it should continue to age well through 2021.

title: Famille Perrin 2013 Coudoulet de Beaucastel Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Unlike many vintages of Coudoulet, this one is medium-bodied and fruit-forward, offering hints of cherries, mulberries and wild Provençal herbs. Those garrigue notes linger on the softly dusty finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Eichinger 2015 Vom Berg Riesling (Kamptal)
description: Slight yeasty notes still cling to the nose but the palate opens up to peach and Mirabelle, to lemon zest and the freshest, crunchiest apples imaginable. This is pure, linear, ripe and poised. Aromatic citrus zest swirls above everything and leaves you refreshed and entranced.

title: Domaine du Clos de l'Elu 2014 Chenin Blanc (Anjou)
description: There is a honeyed aroma to this otherwise dry wine. Rich and full in the mouth, it is a delicious medley of fruit salad flavors. Maybe there is too much alcohol from the superripe grapes but it is fresh, refreshingly fruity with a lightly toasty aftertaste from the wood aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine du Petit Métris 2014 Les Fougeraies  (Savennières)
description: This is a beautiful tangy wine, textured with orange zest and cut with lemon. It is fresh with crisp green plum and pear flavors and youthful acidity. From a single vineyard on the heights above the Loire River, this is mineral driven and still young. Drink from 2020.

title: Gadais Père et Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This is an impressively rich and ripe within the light, poised character of classic Muscadet. It balances floral apple and pear fruit with a tight, mineral texture that gives the wine a young character. The extended lees aging has added notes of almonds and spice to this ripe wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Genium Celler 2010 Red (Priorat)
description: Minerally aromas of crushed stone, schist and red-berry fruits feed into a tight palate with an iron grip. Plum, raspberry, cherry and cassis flavors cover the full spectrum of red fruits, while a chalky, minerally finish confirms the wine's intensity and structure. Drink through 2022.
